results.title: Apple Sets Record 24.2% Global Smartphone Market Share
results.content: Apple recorded a 24.2% market share by sales volume in the global smartphone market in October, achieving its highest-ever monthly figure.

results.title: Apple's Market Position: A Deep Dive into Porter's Five Forces
results.content: In this article, we use the Five Forces model to explore key areas like industry rivalry, the threat of new entrants, the bargaining power of suppliers and buyers, and the risk of substitute products. Apple's success is attributed largely to its ability to innovate and bring unique products to market that have engendered substantial brand loyalty.4 Its product development and marketing strategies reveal an awareness of the need to deal with the major marketplace forces that can impact Apple's market share and profitability. A Five Forces analysis of Apple's position in the technology sector shows industry competition and the bargaining power of buyers as the two strongest marketplace forces that can impact Apple's profitability. Nonetheless, Apple needs to continue strengthening its competitive position through new product development and building brand loyalty to place any potential new entrants to the industry at a greater competitive disadvantage.
